intro: Jacobinia ghiesbreghtiana, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its unique appearance and vibrant color make it a standout in both cultivated and natural settings.
